ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were clasping their knees while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not clasp my knees while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.4_0: he should not clasp his knees while sitting in inhabited areas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, clasps his knees with his hands or with a cloth while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.11_0: if he has entered his dwelling;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.15_0: The sixth training rule is finished.
